info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 04 at 6:25PM CDT until May 04 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN GARVIN...SOUTHEASTERN CLEVELAND AND SOUTHWESTERN MCCLAIN COUNTIES... At 625 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles north of Lindsay, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Southern Norman, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Lindsay, Lexington, Wayne, Washington, Criner, southwestern Lake Thunderbird, Erin Springs and Payne. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
